items.name: Poké Ball
items.overview: A device for catching wild Pokémon. It's thrown like a ball at a Pokémon, comfortably encapsulating its target.

items.name: Great Ball
items.overview: A good, high-performance Poké Ball that provides a higher success rate for catching Pokémon than a standard Poké Ball.

items.name: Ultra Ball
items.overview: An ultra-high-performance Poké Ball that provides a higher success rate for catching Pokémon than a Great Ball.

items.name: Dive Ball
items.overview: A somewhat different Poké Ball that is more effective when catching Pokémon in or on the water.

items.name: Dusk Ball
items.overview: A somewhat different Poké Ball that is more effective when catching Pokémon at night or in dark places, such as caves.

items.name: Heal Ball
items.overview: A remedial Poké Ball that restores HP and eliminates status conditions for a Pokémon caught with it.

items.name: Net Ball
items.overview: A somewhat different Poké Ball that is more effective when catching Water- or Bug-type Pokémon.

items.name: Luxury Ball
items.overview: A particularly comfortable Poké Ball that makes a wild Pokémon quickly grow friendlier after being caught.

items.name: Dire Hit
items.overview: An item that can be used once to sharply boost the critical-hit ratio of a Pokémon in battle. This effect disappears if the Pokémon leaves the battle.

items.name: Guard Spec.
items.overview: An item that prevents Pokémon on your side from having their stats lowered in battle for five turns.

items.name: X Accuracy
items.overview: An item that sharply boosts a Pokémon's accuracy in battle. This effect disappears if the Pokémon leaves the battle.

items.name: X Attack
items.overview: An item that sharply boosts the Attack stat of a Pokémon in battle. This effect disappears if the Pokémon leaves the battle.

items.name: X Defense
items.overview: An item that sharply boosts the Defense stat of a Pokémon in battle. This effect disappears if the Pokémon leaves the battle.

items.name: X Sp.Atk
items.overview: An item that sharply boosts the Sp. Atk stat of a Pokémon in battle. This effect disappears if the Pokémon leaves the battle.

items.name: X Sp.Def
items.overview: An item that sharply boosts the Sp. Def stat of a Pokémon in battle. This effect disappears if the Pokémon leaves the battle.

items.name: X Speed
items.overview: An item that sharply boosts the Speed stat of a Pokémon in battle. This effect disappears if the Pokémon leaves the battle.

items.name: Antidote
items.overview: A spray-type medicine for treating poisoning. It can be used to lift the effects of being poisoned from a Pokémon.

items.name: Awakening
items.overview: A spray-type medicine to wake the sleeping. It can be used to rouse a Pokémon from the clutches of sleep.

items.name: Burn Heal
items.overview: A spray-type medicine for treating burns. It can be used to cure a Pokémon suffering from a burn.

items.name: Ice Heal
items.overview: Heals the Frozen Status Ailment.

items.name: Elixir
items.overview: Restores the PP of all of the Pokémon's moves by 10PP.

items.name: Max Elixir
items.overview: Completely restores the PP of all of the Pokémon's moves by 10PP.

items.name: Ether
items.overview: Restores the PP of one of the Pokémon's moves by 10PP.

items.name: Max Ether
items.overview: A medicine that can be used to fully restore the max PP of a single move that a Pokémon knows.

items.name: Full Restore
items.overview: A medicine that can be used to fully restore the max HP of a Pokémon and cure any status condition it may have.

items.name: Potion
items.overview: A spray-type medicine for treating wounds. It can be used to restore 20 HP to a Pokémon.

items.name: Super Potion
items.overview: A spray-type medicine for treating wounds. It can be used to restore 60 HP to a Pokémon.

items.name: Hyper Potion
items.overview: A spray-type medicine for treating wounds. It can be used to restore 120 HP to a Pokémon.

items.name: Max Potion
items.overview: A spray-type medicine for treating wounds. It can be used to fully restore the max HP of a Pokémon.

items.name: Revive
items.overview: A medicine that can be used to revive a Pokémon that has fainted. It also restores half the Pokémon's max HP.

items.name: Max Revive
items.overview: A medicine that can be used to revive a Pokémon that has fainted. It also fully restores the Pokémon's max HP.

items.name: Acid Spray
items.overview: The user attacks by spitting fluid that works to melt the target. This also harshly lowers the target’s Sp. Def stat.

items.name: Acrobatics
items.overview: The user nimbly strikes the target. This attack does massive damage if the user isn’t holding an item.

items.name: Blizzard
items.overview: A howling blizzard is summoned to strike opposing Pokémon. This may also leave the opposing Pokémon frozen.

items.name: Charm
items.overview: The user gazes at the target rather charmingly, making it less wary. This lowers the target’s Attack stat.

items.name: Dragon Claw
items.overview: The user slashes the target with huge, sharp claws to inflict damage.

items.name: Electro Ball
items.overview: The user hurls an electric orb at the target. The faster the user is that the target, the greater the move’s power.

items.name: Flamethrower
items.overview: The target is scorched with an intense blast of fire. This may also leave the target with a burn.

items.name: Hydro Cannon
items.overview: The target is hit with a watery blast. The user can’t move on the next turn.

items.name: Solar Beam
items.overview: The user gathers light on the first turn, then blasts a bundled beam on the next turn.
